items.title: BASF eyes long-term growth in China despite profit drops
items.summary: FRANKFURT, Feb. 27 (Xinhua) -- The German chemical giant BASF on Friday reported drops in both sales and profit for the 2025 business year, but voiced confidence in its new project in China, eyeing success in the medium term despite the headwinds. Read full story

items.title: Pokémon Day 2026 roundup: All of the most exciting reveals, product releases, and more
items.summary:
Pokémon Day 2026 has been an eventful one. Kicking off with the launch of the new LEGO sets before the 30th anniversary Pokémon Presents officially revealed the new Gen 10 mainline Pokémon Winds and Waves. We then saw the new Pokémon FireRed and LeafGreen officially release on Switch and Switch 2 before we made our way over to the official Nintendo Store in NYC to cap off the celebrations in person, and there are still some new pocket monster experiences set for release next month. Head below to dive into all of today’s most exciting announcements, reveals, and releases.

items.title: Get $449 in FREE gear with Lectric’s 49-pound folding XP Lite2 long-range e-bikes from $999, non-bundled models from $799
items.summary:
Lectric’s ongoing Presidents Day e-bike sale with up to $893 savings is slated to end tomorrow night, which only gives you around 38 hours from the time of writing this to secure your next ride. One popular option that is lighter to manage and folds for storage efficiency is Lectric’s XP Lite2 Long-Range e-bikes with $449 in FREE gear at $999 shipped, as well as the more advanced XP Lite2 JW Black Long-Range Belt Drive e-bike with the same bundle at $1,099 shipped. Instead of shelling out $1,448 and $1,548 for these packages, like always, the savings come in the form of bundled gear, whereas actual price cuts are extremely rare. This bundle includes a rear cargo rack, a fender set, an Elite headlight, a suspension seat post, two adjustable mirrors, and an accordion-style folding bike lock. If you don’t care about the bundled gear, you can find the standard XP Lite2 e-bikes for $799 shipped, while the standard XP Lite2 JW Black Belt Drive model goes for $899 shipped. Head below to learn more about these models or you can browse the full lineup of deals at up to $893 off in our original coverage of this sale here.
